text: Argentina was first at the Olympic Games in 1900. The International Olympic Committee's official abbreviation for Argentina is ARG. "Official abbreviations" at The Games of the XVIII Olympiad, Tokyo, 1964, [p. 9 of 409 PDF]; retrieved 2012-8-16. ==History== Argentine athletes have won a total of 66 medals at the Summer Olympic Games, mostly in boxing. The nation has not won any medals at the Winter Olympic Games. The National Olympic Committee for Argentina was formed and recognized in 1923. == Medal tables == === Medals by Summer Games === 1900 Paris 0 0 0 0 1904 St. Louis did not participate did not participate did not participate did not participate 1908 London 0 0 0 0 1912 Stockholm did not participate did not participate did not participate did not participate 1920 Antwerp 0 0 0 0 1924 Paris 1 3 2 6 1928 Amsterdam 3 3 1 7 1932 Los Angeles 3 1 0 4 1936 Berlin 2 2 3 7 1948 London 3 3 1 7 1952 Helsinki 1 2 2 5 1956 Melbourne/Stockholm 0 1 1 2 1960 Rome 0 1 1 2 1964 Tokyo 0 1 0 1 1968 Mexico City 0 0 2 2 1972 Munich 0 1 0 1 1976 Montreal 0 0 0 0 1980 Moscow did not participate did not participate did not participate did not participate 1984 Los Angeles 0 0 0 0 1988 Seoul 0 1 1 2 1992 Barcelona 0 0 1 1 1996 Atlanta 0 2 1 3 2000 Sydney 0 2 2 4 2004 Athens 2 0 4 6 2008 Beijing 2 0 4 6 2012 London 1 1 2 4 Total Total 18 24 28 70 === Medals by sport === Boxing 7 7 10 24 Athletics 2 3 0 5 Football 2 2 0 4 Polo 2 0 0 2 Rowing 1 1 2 4 Swimming 1 1 1 3 Basketball 1 0 1 2 Taekwondo 1 0 0 1 Cycling 1 0 0 1 Sailing 0 4 5 9 Tennis 0 1 2 3 Field hockey 0 2 2 4 Weightlifting 0 1 1 2 Equestrian 0 1 0 1 Shooting 0 1 0 1 Fencing 0 0 1 1 Judo 0 0 1 1 Volleyball 0 0 1 1 Total 18 24 28 70 ==Related pages== * List of IOC country codes == References == ==Other websites== * * Argentina profile at London2012.com Category:Sport in Argentina Category:Nations at the Olympics Category:National sports teams of Argentina
title: Argentina at the Olympics
